so if such a person realizes the true value of this; the treasure to be found in the darkness

confused or fascinated by or identified by and spend time thinking about but comprehension

and you know we all do actually have some sort of self-observation already in a very latent state
though where we have our ideas of ourselves, and what we think of ourselves, the problem is
we identify with what we have observed up to now before the spiritual path...
it's really important to not identify with any egos, any thoughts, any desires, any defects,
or just any other thought or sensation that you observe in your self-observation practice that you
have throughout the day we do this more easily in meditation but this is you know
this is a next layer of deeper practice when we can apply this to waking life, so this 'identifying'
with what we see in the reflection of our mind is symbolized in Greek mythology as Narcissus
who stared and became fascinated with his beautiful reflection in the water, of course
this is where the word 'narcissist' comes from and Narcissus was told by a 'seer' that he would
live a very long life but only if he did not recognize himself in his reflections...
in other words if he did not identify or become fascinated or hypnotized with his thoughts about
himself, so you see when it comes to observing ourselves whether alone or in the ordinary world
we have to start looking at ourselves and be genuinely detached and curious and think you know
"who is that?", "who is this... that I am experiencing?", "what kind of person am I observing...?",
"what is the nature of this person?"... looking at all the good and bad movements in the consciousness
of this person, without identifying, you can even try looking in a mirror you usually don't take an
active interest when you look in the mirror right, why? because you THINK you know who you are...
so how can we begin to know ourselves if we already think we know, if we already have many
ideas about ourself and our personal history etc, the fire of self-knowledge becomes just a
measly ember in that case, and of course i'm not just talking about looking in a physical mirror
but ultimately through the direct observation of yourself here and now in the mirror of the mind,
so who is listening to this video? why is such a person listening to this video?
what thoughts and reactions are happening in the person as it listens?
don't answer with thoughts, just observe... get to know and get in touch with the presence...
the feeling of the presence of your own inner atmosphere and all the sensations, emotions and
energy of it... let nothing pass... let nothing go undetected without your great fire of awareness

and, start acting as if you don't know who you are as though you don't
recognize who you are, as if you've suddenly just come into this experience experiencing the

so this is all easier when we are doing something we enjoy such as listening to your favorite

unconscious impulses within us, because they give us the opportunity to exercise more

nothing can temper the spirit of a warrior as much as the challenge of dealing with impossible people

withstand the pressure of the unknowable, a warrior who stumbles upon a petty tyrant is a lucky one,
the idea of using a petty tyrant is not only for perfecting the warrior's spirit but also
for enjoyment and happiness, i spent six months in a house exercising warriorship with such
a petty tyrant in a position of power and i succeeded, not once had i felt sorry for myself
or wept in impotence, i had been joyful and serene the entire time, my control and discipline were as
keen as they'd ever been and i had a first-hand view of what forbearance did for impeccable
warriors, he abused and tormented me to great lengths but not once did i wish the man to die",
so one of the most important points that Don Juan makes here is that if you can
endure the challenges of your life with perfect spiritual mastery then you can also withstand
the pressure of the unknowable as he says - the sheer greatness of dimensions of consciousness
beyond this world and so what things can act as a petty tyrant in our psychological gym of life? well
